article: College was the best of times and the worst of times for me. I met the best friends of my life, had _ experiences, but I also folded under more _ than I ever had to deal with before. Because of bad grades, I ended up being asked to take a semester off at the end of the first semester of my senior year. So I went back home to _ with my father and stepmother. To their credit, they understood me and were very cool about my coming back. I felt their _ from the moment I walked in the door. They _ to let me feel like a failure. One morning not long after I had come home, my father woke me up saying that my stepmother passed out on the kitchen floor. I went downstairs trying to perform CPR on her _ it was too late. She was already dead of a massive heart attack. I'll never _ the look on my father's face when he was given the official news of her passing. I knew at that moment that I had to be _ because he needed someone to lean on. It was as if our roles had _ and I was being the protective parent while he took the time to _ . I guess the lesson I took from it is that even in our _ moments we can still be of help to someone who is going through something much harder. It's so easy to close ourselves off to the things going on around us, and _ feel that we are the only ones _ . Helping someone else could actually help us _ ourselves. Needlessly to say I went back to college the next semester, and I studied harder and got my _ . My father and I developed a bond that was _ closer than it already was, and I have a much better ability to keep _ times in perspective.
